column3: RESOLVING THE PROBLEMIBM WebSphere MQ server version 7 0 and later releases provide sharing conversations  SHARECNV  attribute on SVRCONN channel that specifies the maximum number of conversations that can share each TCP IP channel instance

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: This feature can be configured in DataPower as it uses client connection with queue manager SVRCONN channel

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The default setting of sharing conversations  SHARECNV  value is zero in DataPower mq qm object

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The same default value for MQ SVRCONN channel is 10

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The sharing conversations value is negotiated between MQ server and DataPower and the lower value takes effect

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: However  in current versions of the DataPower firmware  the sharing conversations setting of 1 is treated as 0 when negotiating with MQ server

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: There are three use cases to configure Sharing Conversations in DataPower mq qm object  Case  1   The negotiated sharing conversations value is 0   The channel runs in a mode similar to WebSphere MQ V6 and does not uses features such as· Administrator stop quiesce· Heartbeating · Read ahead · Client asynchronous consumeSet a value of 0 or 1 on the Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq qm object in DataPower to disable sharing conversations regardless of the IBM WebSphere MQ SVRCONN setting

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: Case  2  The negotiated sharing conversations value is 1   The channel supports IBM WebSphere MQ V7 and later release features as outlined in case  1  but each TCP IP channel instance has a single conversation

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: Set a value of 1 on the Sharing Conversations attribute and select  on  in Share Single Conversation attribute of the mq qm object in DataPower as shown in the following picture and a value of 1 on IBM WebSphere MQ SVRCONN setting

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The Share Single Conversation attribute is only visible when  Sharing Conversations  is configured with value of  1  and then  RETURN  key is entered

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: For values greater than 1  the  Share Single Conversation  attribute is hidden in the mq qm object

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: support docview wss uid swg21647231 aid 1    support docview wss uid swg21647231 aid 1  Case  3  The negotiated sharing conversations value is 2 or more   The channel supports IBM WebSphere MQ 7 and later release features and each TCP IP channel instance supports 2 or more conversations

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: Set a value of 2 or more on the Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq qm object in DataPower and on the MQ SVRCONN channel

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing

column3: Since DataPower uses a connection pool in processing MQ messages  there are no additional benefits of using sharing conversations with the mq qm object

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: When using a negotiated shared conversations value of 0 as in case  1  mq qm object uses maximum message size as the buffer pool for the MQGET API call

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: However  when mixed message sizes are processed by the same MQ Front Side Handler  FSH   it requests buffer pool based on maximum message size configured in the mq qm object

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing   Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing

column2: Datacap on Citrix  Hi All Can we operate Datacap thin clients on citrix
column3: ANSWERRemote users that access Datacap over a WAN can use Taskmaster Web based  thin clients   or FastDoc Capture operating in offline mode

column2: Datacap on Citrix  Hi All Can we operate Datacap thin clients on citrix
column3: Datacap thick clients  DotScan  DotEdit  and utilities  NENU  Fingerprint Maintenance Tool  require LAN communication speeds and low latency for responsive performance

column2: Datacap on Citrix  Hi All Can we operate Datacap thin clients on citrix
column3: Connect all Datacap Taskmaster Servers  Rulerunner Servers  Web Servers  file servers and databases to a single high performance LAN for best results

column2: Datacap on Citrix  Hi All Can we operate Datacap thin clients on citrix
column3: Network delays between Taskmaster Server  shared files and databases causes degraded performance of Job Monitor and data intensive operations

column2: Datacap on Citrix  Hi All Can we operate Datacap thin clients on citrix
column3: Some customers successfully operate Datacap thick clients in remote sites using Citrix or other remote access technology

column2: Datacap on Citrix  Hi All Can we operate Datacap thin clients on citrix
column3: IBM has not tested or sought certification with Citrix  and does not provide support for Citrix

column2: Datacap on Citrix  Hi All Can we operate Datacap thin clients on citrix
column3: If you deploy Datacap clients on Citrix and encounter issues  IBM may require you to reproduce the issues outside of Citrix as part of the investigation

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  We have had questions from clients planning for leap year years  containing February 29th  asking if WebSphere Application Server Leap Year Compliant  and if any problems are expected stemming from WebSphere Application Server or associated IBM products due to Leap Year

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: There are no known or expected problems

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: Details below  RESOLVING THE PROBLEMWebSphere Application Server and the SDK are leap year compliant

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: IBM Java  SDK   JDK  has been doing leap year testing verification since 1996  including the non leap year 2000 without a problem

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: Basically leap years in Java are explicitly supported by the GregorianCalendar class   that is it s function   and this class is tested with every release of Java as it is part of Java s core functionality

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: So any Java code which uses the GregorianCalendar class will behave correctly

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: WebSphere Application Server performs no specific leap year testing since it runs on top of the SDK which is compliant  and uses function from it

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: We are not aware of any issues in the past with WebSphere Application Server associated with leap year

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: From a JDK perspective  Java applications which use the GregorianCalendar class will be leap year compliant   see the spec at   Same info in the links for the various JDK s  http   docs oracle com javase 6 docs api java util GregorianCalendar html  http   docs oracle com javase 6 docs api java util GregorianCalendar html  http   docs oracle com javase 7 docs api java util GregorianCalendar html  http   docs oracle com javase 7 docs api java util GregorianCalendar html http   docs oracle com javase 8 docs api java util GregorianCalendar html  http   docs oracle com javase 8 docs api java util GregorianCalendar html  Specifically   The only difference between the Gregorian and the Julian calendar is the leap year rule

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: The Julian calendar specifies leap years every four years  whereas the Gregorian calendar omits century years which are not divisible by 400

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: In other words the Gregorian Calendar follows modern leap years

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: The correct operation of the class is tested by the Java Compliance Kit  JCK  which is run against every release of the JVM

column2: Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale  is leap year and leap second compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this  Would like to know if WebSphere Extreme Scale is leap year  compliant  Is there any documentation that talks about this
column3: So Java applications would need to assert that they are using GregorianCalendars to claim leap year compliance

column2: Help with Security Bulletin  Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL affect WebSphere MQ 5 3 and MQ 8 for HPE NonStop Server  CVE 2017 3735  I need to understand details regarding Security Bulletin  Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL affect WebSphere MQ 5 3 and MQ 8 for HPE NonStop Server  CVE 2017 3735   Where can I find this information
column3: SECURITY BULLETINSUMMARY IBM WebSphere MQ 5 3 and IBM MQ 8 for HPE NonStop have addressed a vulnerability in which OpenSSL could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information  caused by an error while parsing an IPAddressFamily extension in an X 509 certificate VULNERABILITY DETAILSCVEID  CVE 2017 3735  http   cve mitre org cgi bin cvename cgi name CVE 2017 3735 DESCRIPTION  OpenSSL could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information  caused by an error while parsing an IPAddressFamily extension in an X 509 certificate

column2: Why am I seeing  CWSXM0100E  Multiple replies have been produced for a single request flow in module    We are building a simple mediation module  consisting only of the request flow  The mediation module has one service invoke calling an external service through web service binding  Upon testing the process  we observe see that the service invoke is being called twice  There is no Fan in or fan  out in the request flow  Below is the error   Caused by  com ibm wsspi sibx mediation flow MediationRuntimeException  CWSXM1023E  Exception when calling flow action  CWSXM0100E  Multiple replies have been produced for a single request flow in module
column3: CWSXM0100E  multiple  replies  single  request TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  When a single request is sent to a Mediation Flow Component in WebSphere Enterprise Service Bus  WebSphere Process Server  or Business Process Manager Advanced  services can be invoked more than once

column2: Why am I seeing  CWSXM0100E  Multiple replies have been produced for a single request flow in module    We are building a simple mediation module  consisting only of the request flow  The mediation module has one service invoke calling an external service through web service binding  Upon testing the process  we observe see that the service invoke is being called twice  There is no Fan in or fan  out in the request flow  Below is the error   Caused by  com ibm wsspi sibx mediation flow MediationRuntimeException  CWSXM1023E  Exception when calling flow action  CWSXM0100E  Multiple replies have been produced for a single request flow in module
column3: SYMPTOMThe following error message can be observed in the SystemOut log file CWSXM0100E  Multiple replies have been produced for a single request flow in module  module name  More than one invocation can occur from a single request

column2: Why am I seeing  CWSXM0100E  Multiple replies have been produced for a single request flow in module    We are building a simple mediation module  consisting only of the request flow  The mediation module has one service invoke calling an external service through web service binding  Upon testing the process  we observe see that the service invoke is being called twice  There is no Fan in or fan  out in the request flow  Below is the error   Caused by  com ibm wsspi sibx mediation flow MediationRuntimeException  CWSXM1023E  Exception when calling flow action  CWSXM0100E  Multiple replies have been produced for a single request flow in module
column3: CAUSEThis error occurs when a mediation primitive is wired more than once to the next mediation primitive

column3: The following example is a sample configuration of new options  which you can configure in the 100Custom xml file   server       mime type white list which specifies mime types accepted for          upload to document list or document attachment      document attachment accepted mime types       specifies whether to allow a null mime type for upload      allow null mime type false  allow null mime type       lists the mime types allowed for upload      mime type text plain  mime type   mime type img png  mime type    document attachment accepted mime types       mime type black list which specifies mappings from unacceptable          mime types to acceptable mime types for download from          document list or document attachment      document attachment download mime types       will map text html mime type to text plain mime type      mime type map   from text html  from   to text plain  to    mime type map       missing  to  element implies mapping to content octet stream      mime type map   from application pdf  from    mime type map    document attachment download mime types    server  Note  The default configuration  which does not include the configuration information that is provided in the 100Custom xml file  acts as a blacklist for the text html MIME type and maps it to the text plain MIME type

column2: You want to know how to make persistent the events that indicate when a queue manager has started and stopped  You want to know how to make persistent the events that indicate when a queue manager has started and stopped
column3: CONTENTFirst  a baseline scenario is described in which when using the defaults  there is only 1 record in the SYSTEM ADMIN QMGR EVENT queue  regardless of how many times you restart the queue manager

column2: You want to know how to make persistent the events that indicate when a queue manager has started and stopped  You want to know how to make persistent the events that indicate when a queue manager has started and stopped
column3: Second  a modification is done to the SYSTEM ADMIN QMGR EVENT queue to indicate that the default persistence is enabled  and thus  subsequent events from the stop start of the queue manager will be kept in the queue

column3: alter ql SYSTEM ADMIN QMGR EVENT  defpsist YES Caveat If you want to have persistent messages in the SYSTEM ADMIN QMGR EVENT queue you will need to have discipline and a procedure to get and remove the messages  otherwise  the queue will eventually fill up

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  When to enable Sharing Conversations in DataPower MQ Queue Manager  mq qm  object along with SHARECNV attribute of the MQ SVRCONN channel

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: RESOLVING THE PROBLEMIBM WebSphere MQ server version 7 0 and later releases provide sharing conversations  SHARECNV  attribute on SVRCONN channel that specifies the maximum number of conversations that can share each TCP IP channel instance

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: This feature can be configured in DataPower as it uses client connection with queue manager SVRCONN channel

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The default setting of sharing conversations  SHARECNV  value is zero in DataPower mq qm object

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The same default value for MQ SVRCONN channel is 10

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The sharing conversations value is negotiated between MQ server and DataPower and the lower value takes effect

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: However  in current versions of the DataPower firmware  the sharing conversations setting of 1 is treated as 0 when negotiating with MQ server

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: There are three use cases to configure Sharing Conversations in DataPower mq qm object  Case  1   The negotiated sharing conversations value is 0   The channel runs in a mode similar to WebSphere MQ V6 and does not uses features such as· Administrator stop quiesce· Heartbeating · Read ahead · Client asynchronous consumeSet a value of 0 or 1 on the Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq qm object in DataPower to disable sharing conversations regardless of the IBM WebSphere MQ SVRCONN setting

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: Case  2  The negotiated sharing conversations value is 1   The channel supports IBM WebSphere MQ V7 and later release features as outlined in case  1  but each TCP IP channel instance has a single conversation

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: Set a value of 1 on the Sharing Conversations attribute and select  on  in Share Single Conversation attribute of the mq qm object in DataPower as shown in the following picture and a value of 1 on IBM WebSphere MQ SVRCONN setting

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The Share Single Conversation attribute is only visible when  Sharing Conversations  is configured with value of  1  and then  RETURN  key is entered

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: For values greater than 1  the  Share Single Conversation  attribute is hidden in the mq qm object

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: support docview wss uid swg21647231 aid 1    support docview wss uid swg21647231 aid 1  Case  3  The negotiated sharing conversations value is 2 or more   The channel supports IBM WebSphere MQ 7 and later release features and each TCP IP channel instance supports 2 or more conversations

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: Set a value of 2 or more on the Sharing Conversations attribute of the mq qm object in DataPower and on the MQ SVRCONN channel

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: On average  processing of messages from client applications is 15 percent slower when using SHARECNV 10  as compared to SHARECNV 0

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: Please refer to Performance Implications of Sharing  http   www ibm com support knowledgecenter SSFKSJ 7 0 1 com ibm mq csqzaf doc mi12240  htm Conversations on Client connection Channels

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: http   www ibm com support knowledgecenter SSFKSJ 7 0 1 com ibm mq csqzaf doc mi12240  htm

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: Since DataPower uses a connection pool in processing MQ messages  there are no additional benefits of using sharing conversations with the mq qm object

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: However  in situations when mixed message sizes are used by the same mq qm object  using case  2 will benefit mq qm object as it will use new buffer management feature of IBM WebSphere MQ Version 7 when making MQGET API call

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: When using a negotiated shared conversations value of 0 as in case  1  mq qm object uses maximum message size as the buffer pool for the MQGET API call

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: However  when mixed message sizes are processed by the same MQ Front Side Handler  FSH   it requests buffer pool based on maximum message size configured in the mq qm object

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: The use of fixed buffer pool for small and large messages can deplete MQ server s allocated buffer and contribute to unexpected termination of MQ SVRCONN channel instance and may terminate the queue manager

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: In such a situation  using a negotiated sharing conversations value of 1 as in case  2 will benefit DataPower mq qm object as it will use IBM WebSphere MQ Version 7 Read Ahead feature and the new buffer management feature for MQGET API call

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: IBM WebSphere MQ V8 release provides enhanced performance for case  2  when the negotiated sharing conversations value is 1

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: For DataPower firmware releases 7 0 0 x  7 1 0 x  7 2 0 x and earlier  one should follow case  1 and use a negotiated sharing conversations value of 0

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing
column3: If you configure these firmware versions with case  2 or case  3  DataPower device may reload or hang due to connection instability and generate many MQ errors with Reason Code   2009 and 2059

column2: When should I use conversation sharing in DataPower MQ queue managers  MQ version 7 0 introduced a new feature  conversation sharing  Are there any special values on DataPower when configuring conversation sharing

column3: CAUSEBecause of an interface change in IBM Pure Application System 2 1 2 0  and in 2 2 0 0 and greater  installation and upgrade of IBM MQ at the latest maintenance level contained in the pattern type fails

column3: SECURITY BULLETINSUMMARY Transport Layer Security  TLS  padding vulnerability via a POODLE  Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption  like attack affects IBM PureApplication System

column2: Help with Security Bulletin  TLS padding vulnerability affects IBM PureApplication System  CVE 2014 8730  I need to understand details regarding  Security Bulletin  TLS padding vulnerability affects IBM PureApplication System  CVE 2014 8730    Where can I find this information
column3: VULNERABILITY DETAILSCVEID  CVE 2014 8730  http   cve mitre org cgi bin cvename cgi name CVE 2014 8730 DESCRIPTION  IBM PureApplication Server bundles IBM HTTP Server  which could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information  caused by the failure to check the contents of the padding bytes when using CBC cipher suites of some TLS implementations

column2: Help with Security Bulletin  TLS padding vulnerability affects IBM PureApplication System  CVE 2014 8730  I need to understand details regarding  Security Bulletin  TLS padding vulnerability affects IBM PureApplication System  CVE 2014 8730    Where can I find this information
column3: A remote user with the ability to conduct a man in the middle attack could exploit this vulnerability via a POODLE  Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption  like attack to decrypt sensitive information and calculate the plain text of secure connections

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: ISA data collection datacollection logs bpmdc isadc NEWSABSTRACT The new data collector in IBM Business Process Manager V8 5 is designed for ease of use to gather some of the standard information that is needed to debug IBM Business Process Manager issues

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: This command line tool can gather log file or configuration information and upload it to a Problem Management Record  PMR

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: This collector is also included in IBM Business Process Manager V8 0 1 Fix Pack 3

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: CONTENTThe script gathers various product information  compresses it into a  zip file  and can optionally send the compressed file to IBM for a PMR

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: You can also use this tool to compress the data without sending it to IBM

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: The command is profile root bin bpmdcThe profile root variable is the base profile directory for the profile from which you want to get data

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Common Examples To gather the logs and upload them to ECURep  C  MyProfileDirectory bin bpmdc  PMR 12345 678 901  uploadToIBM yes To gather the logs and config directory  C  MyProfileDirectory bin bpmdc  PMR 12345 678 901  uploadToIBM yes  config yes To gather logs for installation issues  C  MyProfileDirectory bin bpmdc  PMR 12345 678 901  uploadToIBM yes  type Install To gather 3 java cores from MyAppServer at 60 second intervals  C  MyProfileDirectory bin bpmdc  PMR 12345 678 901  uploadToIBM yes  type Dump  server MyAppServer  soapport 8881  user admin  password admin  dumptype Thread  count 3  interval 60 Command Line Parameter Default Value Description PMR None This parameter is the 11 digit PMR number to which the data is associated

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Use one of the following forms for this value  12345 678 901 or  12345 678 901 Note  Comma characters can be an issue on the Microsoft Windows command line if you do not surround the value with the double quote characters

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: uploadToIBM no This parameter specifies whether to upload the data to the IBM ECURep site for a particular PMR

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: You can set this value to yes or no

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: outputDirectory install root BPM isadc This parameter specifies the path to the directory where the output collection  zip file will be stored

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: type General This parameter specifies which type of collection to run

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: The valid values are General  Install  or Dump 8 5 5

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: config no With a general collection  when you set this parameter to yes  the config directory is included

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: You can set this value to yes or no

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: help No values When you include this parameter with the command  a description of the command options is displayed

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Server Connection options added in 8 5 5 Required for  type Dump server No default This option specifies the server from which you wish to collect JVM dumps

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: soapport No default This option specifies the SOAP port for the server

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: user No default This option specifies the user with wsadmin access to the server to which you are connecting

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: password No default This option specifies the password for the user

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Dump options added in 8 5 5 Available for  type Dump dumptype Thread This option specifies the type of Java™ virtual machine  JVM  dump to trigger  Thread   Javacore or thread dump

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Heap   A Heap dump is generated

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: System   System dump is also generated and has JExtract run on it

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: count 1 This option specifies the number of JVM dumps to trigger during the collection

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: interval 0 This option specifies the interval in seconds to wait between JVM dumps

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: You can run the command without any parameters  which results in the general collection being run and the logs directory is compressed into a  zip file

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: The output file name has the following format  PMRnumber

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: type   timeStampValue  zipIn V8 5 5 the format is changed to  PMRnumber

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: ProfileName type   timeStampValue  zip The data gathered is based on the profile where the command is run

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: If it is run from the installation directory  then the default profile is used

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Note  Be sure to run the command from the profile from which you wish to gather data

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: General collection The  General  collection gathers the following information     Profile logs directory  profile root logs

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: The collected files include all of the server log files and trace under this profile directory

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: The results of the versionInfo maintenancePackages command

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Optionally  The profile config directory  profile root config

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: This directory is only collected when the  config yes option is used

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Note  The limitation with this collection is that it does not gather log files and trace if it goes to a custom directory outside of the Profile logs directory

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: It is not recommended that you change the log file locations from the default as it makes it more difficult for other people to find them

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Install collectionThe  Install  collection gathers the following information that is listed in the Collect troubleshooting data for installation or upgrade problems with IBM Business Process Manager products  http   www ibm com support docview wss uid swg21506937  document     Any temporary launchpad log files

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Installation Manager Data directory    The results of the versionInfo  maintenancePackages command    Installation logs directory    Profile logs directory    Database upgrade script log files    Various configuration files that are related to the installation processJVM Dump collection The  Dump  collection type triggers various JVM dumps on a target server within a profile prior to gathering the general collection and generated dumps

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: With the provided server connection options  the command will connect to the server using the soapport to make a wsadmin connection with the user and password

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Depending on the dump type  it will trigger various JVM dumps until the count amount is reached

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: The dumps are triggered a set number of seconds apart based on the interval that is set

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: The collection will gather the general collection files like  logs and version information in addition to the dump files like Javacores  heap dumps and system dump  zip files

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Thread   This type will trigger Javacores or thread dumps to be produced for the JVM

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Heap   This type will trigger heap dumps to be generated

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: System   This type will trigger system dumps to be generated

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: It will also run JExtract on the dump prior to the upload  which can take some time depending on the heap size

column2: IBM Support Assistant data collector for BPM What can I use to obtain some standard information in order to debug my IBM Business Process Manager environment
column3: Common usage The following list provides some common usage scenarios for this command     After an issue occurs  use the basic bpmdc command to compress the log files for the profile into a  zip file

column2: Why do I receive the message   IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION    for a TSO SEND command  If you issue the TSO SEND command in a batch job and receive this message IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION IKJ79154I REASON CODE X 00000004
column3: IKJEESX0 TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  IBM Rational Developer for z Systems  RDz  using TSO Send command may result in the error IKJ79154I for TSO EXIT IKJEESX0  RC 04SYMPTOMIssuing the TSO SEND command in a batch job may terminate with this message  IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION

column2: Why do I receive the message   IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION    for a TSO SEND command  If you issue the TSO SEND command in a batch job and receive this message IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION IKJ79154I REASON CODE X 00000004
column3: IKJ79154I REASON CODE X 00000004

column2: Why do I receive the message   IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION    for a TSO SEND command  If you issue the TSO SEND command in a batch job and receive this message IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION IKJ79154I REASON CODE X 00000004
column3: CAUSEThe RDz TSO Send command will invoke a TSO exit  IKJEESX0  FEKEESX0  that will terminate with a reason code of 4 if you have not coded a facility class for the FEK CMD SEND and FEK CMD SEND CLEAR

column2: Why do I receive the message   IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION    for a TSO SEND command  If you issue the TSO SEND command in a batch job and receive this message IKJ79154I INSTALLATION EXIT IKJEESX0 REQUESTED TERMINATION IKJ79154I REASON CODE X 00000004
column3: The exit provided by RDz checks to see if the user has the authority to issue the TSO Send command by executing the RACROUTE macro RACROUTE REQUEST AUTH CLASS  R5  ENTITYX  rEntityBL    WORKA  R0  RELEASE 2 2 ATTR READ LOG NOSTAT   MF  E AUTHCHK  RESOLVING THE PROBLEMCode the appropriate security definitions for FEK CMD SEND and FEK CMD SEND CLEAR

column2: How to control SDMS database size  Hi ITCAM for SOA 7 1 1 was installed about 3 years ago  I already know that SDMS database size may increase with no limit  Has anyone found a way to keep under control this behavior Thanks
column3: CAMSOAALL CAMSOADB CAMSOAPERF REQMETRICS RESPMETRICS kd4TrimDB2db TECHNOTE  FAQ QUESTION As the KD4SDMS grows unbounded  is there a way to regularly prune it

column2: How to control SDMS database size  Hi ITCAM for SOA 7 1 1 was installed about 3 years ago  I already know that SDMS database size may increase with no limit  Has anyone found a way to keep under control this behavior Thanks
column3: ANSWERRegarding the older release ITCAM for SOA 7 1 1  there is no a mechanism to automatically regularly prune the KD4SDMS database

column2: How to control SDMS database size  Hi ITCAM for SOA 7 1 1 was installed about 3 years ago  I already know that SDMS database size may increase with no limit  Has anyone found a way to keep under control this behavior Thanks
column3: The following Wiki page has been published on the topic https   www ibm com developerworks community wikis home lang en   wiki Tivoli Composite Application Manager page Pruning SDMS Relationship Metrics Tables  https   www ibm com developerworks community wikis home lang en   wiki Tivoli Composite Application Manager page Pruning SDMS Relationship Metrics Tables To keep only the latest 24 hours every day  regular pruning   you can schedule a daily job to run the kd4TrimDB2db utility provided above

column2: How to control SDMS database size  Hi ITCAM for SOA 7 1 1 was installed about 3 years ago  I already know that SDMS database size may increase with no limit  Has anyone found a way to keep under control this behavior Thanks
column3: As for the newer ITCAM for SOA 7 2  there is a cleanup task that runs on the TEPS host where SDMS database is installed

column2: How to control SDMS database size  Hi ITCAM for SOA 7 1 1 was installed about 3 years ago  I already know that SDMS database size may increase with no limit  Has anyone found a way to keep under control this behavior Thanks
column3: It deletes REQMETRICS and RESPMETRICS table rows where SRTTIME  start of period  is more than 24 hours ago

column2: How to control SDMS database size  Hi ITCAM for SOA 7 1 1 was installed about 3 years ago  I already know that SDMS database size may increase with no limit  Has anyone found a way to keep under control this behavior Thanks
column3: So these two tables  which are responsible for most of KD4SDMS storage occupation  should not grow unbounded anymore

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: tema enable baselining Unknown application health status CAMADALL CAMADINST TECHNOTE  FAQ THIS DOCUMENT APPLIES ONLY TO THE FOLLOWING LANGUAGE VERSION S   US English QUESTION Steps to enable Baselining in your monitored application

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: ANSWERThe health of the monitored application is calculated against an internally stored baseline threshold

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: The baselining of the application is a process that uses a pre defined mathematical and statistical method to automatically calculate a threshold based on response time information typically collected over a period of time  few days to few weeks

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: By default baselining gets enabled with a situation WasAppDiscoverd

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: This situation is enabled by default and will discover new applications then run a take action to start the baselining

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: So if this situation is not enabled then you should enable it and assign to the ITCAM App Server managing system list

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: You want to do baselining with normal or typical load on the server over a period of few days to few weeks  or even few months

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: The performance of the application under this load is considered good  you will see  Good   in the Application Health views  and deviation from this performance indicates degrading health   Bad  or  Fair  in the Application Health views  of the monitored application

column2: What is the meaning of value  unknown  for ITCAM WAS Application Status attribute  I am getting alerts from a situation containing the following statement in its formula IF  VALUE Application Health Status Application Status  NE RunningI ve found out this happens because the application status for one application is  Unknown  in the Application Health workspace Why was the application status Unknown   what does it mean
column3: To start baselining for your application server  please follow these steps   Note 1  in this example  I ve used a WebSphere based application but you can also do the same for any application on your J2EE agent also

column3: Note 2  Before beginning baselining  make sure you have typical or normal load on the server to set the baselining threshold values

column2: Crash happened due to  PI50993 Apache HTTPComponents vulnerabilities in WebSphere Application Server  CVE 2012 6153  CVE 2014 3577   Crash happened due to  PI50993 Apache HTTPComponents vulnerabilities in WebSphere Application Server  CVE 2012 6153  CVE 2014 3577  Details of gpf crash events  A VerifyError was thrown due to  Inaccessible class  at offset 39 0x27  of the method executeInternal Lorg springframework http HttpHeaders  B Lorg springfram ework http client ClientHttpResponse of the above class org springframework http client HttpComponentsClientHttpRequest Looking at method the bytecodes  31 invokespecial 15 org apache http entity ByteArrayEntity   B V 34 astore 4 36 aload3 37 aload 4 39 invokeinterface2 41 invokeinterface 16 org apache http HttpEntityEnclosingRequest setEntity Lorg apache http Ht tpEntity  VThe above sequence of bytecodes indicates it created an instance of org apache http entity ByteArrayEntity  trying to cast it to type Lorg apache http HttpEntity  which in turns led to the  Inaccessible class  VerifyError message It is clear that class org apache http HttpEntity was not loaded at all     allclasses   grep org apache http HttpEntity

column2: Why is the reload   not clearing the attribute cache so I can see my newly updated LDAP data in real time  You are leveraging the reload   functionality as described in the blog post   https   www ibm com developerworks community blogs PortalL2Thoughts entry how to programatically refresh data from ldap64 lang ento refresh the attribute cache after a change has been made to data within your LDAP  The purpose of this reload   is to update the data in real time on the Portal server  You discover that you are calling the reload    however  the newly updated data is not immediately available to the application  Why is that

column3: ERROR DESCRIPTION    If base entry and name in repository is different and   clearCache functionality is used with clearEntity mode then   virtual member manager  VMM  still looks in the cache and gets   the entity from the cache instead of fetching it from the LDAP   server

column2: Why is the reload   not clearing the attribute cache so I can see my newly updated LDAP data in real time  You are leveraging the reload   functionality as described in the blog post   https   www ibm com developerworks community blogs PortalL2Thoughts entry how to programatically refresh data from ldap64 lang ento refresh the attribute cache after a change has been made to data within your LDAP  The purpose of this reload   is to update the data in real time on the Portal server  You discover that you are calling the reload    however  the newly updated data is not immediately available to the application  Why is that
column3: Problems occur only if there is a different   base entry used than the name in the repository entry

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: CLP  insert  codepage  unicode  wrong codepoints  CharConversionException TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  During insert from the CLP there is no codepage conversion if operating system codepage and database codepage are both UTF 8

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: In this case data to be inserted should also be in UTF 8 encoding

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: If data has a different encoding then the database codepage  this can be verified using any hex editor   then the operating system codepage should be changed to match the data s encoding in order to enforce the data conversion to the database codepage

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: SYMPTOMError executing Select SQL statement

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: Caught by java io CharConversionException

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: ERRORCODE  4220  Caused by  java nio charset MalformedInputException  Input length   4759 at com ibm db2 jcc b u a u java 19  at com ibm db2 jcc b bc a bc java 1762  CAUSEDuring an insert of data using CLP characters  they do not go through codepage conversion

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: If operating system and database codepage both are UTF 8  but the data to be inserted is not Unicode  then data in the database might have incorrect codepoints  not Unicode  and the above error will be a result during data retrieval

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: To verify the encoding for data to be inserted you can use any editor that shows hex representation of characters

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: Please verify the codepoints for non ASCII characters that you try to insert

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: If you see only 1 byte per non ASCII characters then you need to force the database conversion during insert from CLP to UTF 8 database

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: To force codepage conversion during insert from the CLP make sure that the operating system codepage is non Unicode and matching to the codepage of data when you insert data to Unicode database from non Unicode data source

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: Problem DetailsAn example problem scenario is as follows  1

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: Create a database of type UTF 8           CREATE DATABASE  db  USING CODESET utf 8 TERRITORY US            2

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: Create a table that holds character data           CREATE TABLE test  col char 20              3

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: Check operating system locale           locale LANG en US UTF 8      LC CTYPE  en US UTF 8             4

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: Insert the non ASCII characters  Ã     ³    ©  which have codepoint 0x C3   0x B3  0x A9  in codepage 819 into the table           INSERT INTO test VALUES   Ã       INSERT INTO test VALUES   ³       INSERT INTO test VALUES   ©              5

column2: Table       could not be found When doing a table mapping with DB2 as source  selecting a table which contains special characters on column comments like COMMENT ON COLUMN    IS  Test comment ‘1’ complete  Mapping fails with following error message  Table   could not be found in the database   What s the reason for the error
column3: By running the following statement  you can see that all INSERT statements caused only one byte to be inserted into the table           SELECT col  HEX col  FROM test               Ã C3     ³ B3     © A9          However  the UTF 8 representation of those characters are  0x C383  for  Ã   0x C2B3  for  ³   and 0x C2A9  for  ©

column3: So these three rows in the table contain invalid characters in UTF 8

column3: APAR STATUS   CLOSED AS PROGRAM ERROR

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: ERROR DESCRIPTION    The On Demand Router  ODR  has a memory leak related to   HttpRouteAction objects such that when the system is under load   and there are configuration changes such as uninstalling and   installing applications it is possible that multiple  redundant   HttpRouteAction objects can be created with registered   listeners for ODC tree changes but never removed

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: This will   eventually fill up the available heap space and cause an Out Of   Memory issue on the ODR

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: Restarting the ODR will correct the   problem

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: LOCAL FIX    Restart the ODR

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: PROBLEM SUMMARY                                                                         USERS AFFECTED   All users of IBM WebSphere Application                             Server Intelligent Management using the                            java On Demand Router  ODR

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: PROBLEM DESCRIPTION  An Out Of Memory error can be seen on                              the On Demand Router because                                       HttpRouteAction objects can                                        accumulate

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: RECOMMENDATION                                                                                                                      There is a code bug where HttpRouteAction objects can   accumulate because they are not freed

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: This is particularly   noticeable when there are routing rules present  many   applications installed  and multiple configuration changes   happening on the system  such as installing or removing   applications

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: Over time this can cause exhaustion of the   available heap and an Out Of Memory error for the On Demand   Router

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: PROBLEM CONCLUSION    The area of code was corrected to release the HttpRouteAction   objects

column2: ODR OOM issue I got ODR OOM after upgrading the WAS to v8553  No configuration or traffic load changing  Do I need a fix pack
column3: This fix supercedes PI51978  http   www 01 ibm com support docview wss uid swg1PI51978

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  Excessive lock duration during FileNet CM object store addon creation may result in SQL lock timeouts that will cause addon installation to fail

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: SYMPTOMDB transactions are rolled back due to SQL timeout

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: CAUSEWhen multiple DB2 pureScale members are active during FileNet CM addon creation  excessive SQL locking may occur  resulting in a potential lock timeout

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: This can result in transactions being rolled back  thereby resulting in the addon installation failing

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: DIAGNOSING THE PROBLEMExamine both the P8 error log and the DB2 diagnostic logs for each active member for lock timeout error messages similar to the following DB2  db2diag log  FUNCTION  DB2 UDB  lock manager  sqlplWaitOnWP  probe 999  MESSAGE   ZRC 0x80100044  2146435004 SQLP LTIMEOUT LockTimeOut   tran rollback Reason code 68 P8  p8 server error log   com filenet api exception EngineRuntimeException  FNRCE0019E  E DEADLOCK ERROR  The operation could not be completed due to a deadlock error

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: A retry might be appropriate

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: Caused by  com ibm db2 jcc am SqlTransactionRollbackException  DB2 SQL Error  SQLCODE  911  SQLSTATE 40001  SQLERRMC 68  DRIVER 4 15 82Note  The SQLERRMC 68 suggests that the root cause is a SQL lock timeout even though the P8 error message and SQLCODE suggest a deadlock occurred

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: RESOLVING THE PROBLEMThe lock timeouts can be avoided by only having a single DB2 pureScale member active during FileNet CM addon installation

column2: Does the BPM internal Document Store work with IBM DB2 pureScale  I use IBM DB2 pureScale with my BPM installation  During startup of the server and initialization of the internal document store I see hanging threads in the systemOut log and the process will not finish  How can this be solved
column3: Once addon installation has completed successfully  the other members can be brought back online

column2: Netcool Impact 6 1 1  Policy Custom Function not getting variable value Netcool Impact 6 1 1  Policy Custom Function not getting variable valueCustom Function call      ProcessFunction GotNodes 0  AlertKey   of a result set acquired by GetByFilter      GotNodes GetByFilter ObjServ Alerts DT  Node      Node      False   still fails to use the acquired variable even when there is a value for both GotNodes and GotNodes 0  AlertKey
column3: netcool impact  nci  netcool  impact  user  defined  user defined function  UDF  UserDefinedFunction  UserDefined  custom function  CustomFunction  function  sql  null  variable  value  call  error  exception  functioncall TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  A variable provided in a User Defined Function call is not received within the function action

column2: Netcool Impact 6 1 1  Policy Custom Function not getting variable value Netcool Impact 6 1 1  Policy Custom Function not getting variable valueCustom Function call      ProcessFunction GotNodes 0  AlertKey   of a result set acquired by GetByFilter      GotNodes GetByFilter ObjServ Alerts DT  Node      Node      False   still fails to use the acquired variable even when there is a value for both GotNodes and GotNodes 0  AlertKey
column3: SYMPTOMThe User Defined Function call is of the style        and MyResultSet was acquired in a previous GetBy   for example     and this was proven to have received a result                             Any attempt to use that value in the User Defined Function will report a NULL style error if it is not able to handle a null value or just simply fail to produce the expected results

column2: Netcool Impact 6 1 1  Policy Custom Function not getting variable value Netcool Impact 6 1 1  Policy Custom Function not getting variable valueCustom Function call      ProcessFunction GotNodes 0  AlertKey   of a result set acquired by GetByFilter      GotNodes GetByFilter ObjServ Alerts DT  Node      Node      False   still fails to use the acquired variable even when there is a value for both GotNodes and GotNodes 0  AlertKey
column3: RESOLVING THE PROBLEMAssigning the variable prior to the function call will ensure that the value is passed to the User Defined Function
