column2: DB2 Non Reclaimable Storage   We have tablespaces defined under DB2 9 5 that apparently are not ableto reclaim storage back to the OS  but does that mean DB2 cannot reusethis space as well
column3: SQL1763N  Alter Tablespace  reclaimable storage  DMS  Automatic storage table spaces  MON GET TABLESPACE  RECLAIMABLE SPACE ENABLED  SMS  DB2 Version 9 7  lower high water mark TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  Receiving SQL1763N error with Reason Code 11 while running  Alter Tablespace  command to reclaim unused storage space against DMS or automatic storage tablespaces

column2: DB2 Non Reclaimable Storage   We have tablespaces defined under DB2 9 5 that apparently are not ableto reclaim storage back to the OS  but does that mean DB2 cannot reusethis space as well
column3: SYMPTOMFollowing reasons apply     If the DMS or automatic storage tablespaces are not created in DB2 Version 9 7 or later  as the  Reclaimable Storage  is not available in tablespaces created in earlier versions V9 1 V9 5  of the DB2 product

column2: DB2 Non Reclaimable Storage   We have tablespaces defined under DB2 9 5 that apparently are not ableto reclaim storage back to the OS  but does that mean DB2 cannot reusethis space as well
column3: Trying to alter a SMS tablespace as this feature is not supported on SMS tablespaces

column2: DB2 Non Reclaimable Storage   We have tablespaces defined under DB2 9 5 that apparently are not ableto reclaim storage back to the OS  but does that mean DB2 cannot reusethis space as well
column3: Example testcase on a TEMPSPACE1 SMS tablespace

column3: DB21034E The command was processed as an SQL statement because it was not a valid Command Line Processor command

column2: DB2 Non Reclaimable Storage   We have tablespaces defined under DB2 9 5 that apparently are not ableto reclaim storage back to the OS  but does that mean DB2 cannot reusethis space as well

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: TECHNOTE  FAQ QUESTION How do I export and import private keys between the same or different Hardware Security Module  HSM  enabled IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA Appliance

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: ANSWERHSM enabled DataPower appliances support the export of private keys using the crypto export command

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: For key export to work  various conditions must be met     HSMs must be initialized and in the same key sharing domain on exporting and importing machines    The private key in question must be marked exportable at keygen time  see keygen s exportable option     HSMs on exporting and importing machines must share internal key wrapping keys  see hsm clone kwk command

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: A key wrapping key is a key that encrypts another key

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: Each HSM has a special key inside of it  the key wrapping key  that is used to encrypt exported private keys  and to decrypt imported private keys

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: If the goal is to restore exported keys to the same appliance  then you don t need to worry about hsm clone kwk  red keys  or the hsm domain parameter

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: That is because the key wrapping key at import time will already match the key wrapping key at export time  since the HSM device is the same

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: If the goal is to move exported keys from one appliance to another one  then all of the steps in this section must be followed    First  the two HSMs in question must be both be initialized and in the same key sharing domain

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: This means that they must both be initialized in the same mode  both in Security Level 2 or both in Security Level 3

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: In Security Level 2 mode  they must have used the same hsm domain parameter during hsm reinit  this parameter has a default value that is the same on all appliances

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: In Security Level 3 mode  they must have used the same red PED key during hsm reinit  and the second initialization must not have overwritten the key value from the first initialization

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: Second  the key to be exported must be exportable

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: The exportability of keys is immutable

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: It is determined at keygen time  and it is controlled by that command s exportable parameter

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: If a key was created outside of the appliance  not using keygen   then it is always considered exportable

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: Finally  before the crypto export crypto import sequence  the key wrapping keys must be synchronized using the hsm clone kwk command

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: This command must be run four times  once on the source HSM appliance  with the key wrapping key you are copying   once on the destination HSM appliance  once again on the source HSM appliance  and once again on the destination HSM appliance

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: Each time the command is run  it will need the output file from the previous step  as the input to the current step  which must be moved manually  usually with the copy command

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: Once all of this has been done  then private keys may move from system to system with crypto export and crypto import

column2: How can I export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance  Is it possible to export a private key from DataPower Gateway Appliance
column3: Note that the non HSM appliance can export keys immediately at keygen time  but never at a later time

column2: Why are the users unable to login to Web GUI 8 1 after I modify timeout to 2147483647 in security xml file   I followed the Web GUI 8 1 reference guide here to switching off the session timeouthttp   www 01 ibm com support knowledgecenter SSSHTQ 8 1 0 com ibm netcool OMNIbus doc 8 1 0 webtop wip task web adm settimeout htmlAfter I edited  config cells JazzSMNode01Cell security xml file  modified timeout setting to 2147483647  users are not able to login anymore
column3: DASHL2  session  time out  timeout  cannot login  locked out   2147483647  security xml TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  Using a big value  2147483647  for the session timeout setting in DASH  to achieve the maximum time between timeouts  is causing users to be locked out completely

column2: Why are the users unable to login to Web GUI 8 1 after I modify timeout to 2147483647 in security xml file   I followed the Web GUI 8 1 reference guide here to switching off the session timeouthttp   www 01 ibm com support knowledgecenter SSSHTQ 8 1 0 com ibm netcool OMNIbus doc 8 1 0 webtop wip task web adm settimeout htmlAfter I edited  config cells JazzSMNode01Cell security xml file  modified timeout setting to 2147483647  users are not able to login anymore
column3: SYMPTOMAfter entering the user ID and password in the login page  and then pressing the  continue  button the login page does not change  stuck at  processing  and then returns to the login page again

column2: Why are the users unable to login to Web GUI 8 1 after I modify timeout to 2147483647 in security xml file   I followed the Web GUI 8 1 reference guide here to switching off the session timeouthttp   www 01 ibm com support knowledgecenter SSSHTQ 8 1 0 com ibm netcool OMNIbus doc 8 1 0 webtop wip task web adm settimeout htmlAfter I edited  config cells JazzSMNode01Cell security xml file  modified timeout setting to 2147483647  users are not able to login anymore
column3: All users get essentially locked out completely from DASH sessions

column2: Why are the users unable to login to Web GUI 8 1 after I modify timeout to 2147483647 in security xml file   I followed the Web GUI 8 1 reference guide here to switching off the session timeouthttp   www 01 ibm com support knowledgecenter SSSHTQ 8 1 0 com ibm netcool OMNIbus doc 8 1 0 webtop wip task web adm settimeout htmlAfter I edited  config cells JazzSMNode01Cell security xml file  modified timeout setting to 2147483647  users are not able to login anymore
column3: CAUSEIn order to maximize the time between session timeouts  the customer is setting the timeout parameter in the security xml file to 2147483647

column2: Why are the users unable to login to Web GUI 8 1 after I modify timeout to 2147483647 in security xml file   I followed the Web GUI 8 1 reference guide here to switching off the session timeouthttp   www 01 ibm com support knowledgecenter SSSHTQ 8 1 0 com ibm netcool OMNIbus doc 8 1 0 webtop wip task web adm settimeout htmlAfter I edited  config cells JazzSMNode01Cell security xml file  modified timeout setting to 2147483647  users are not able to login anymore
column3: This timeout parameter used in the security xml file is a WAS setting  but DASH is using a javascript call  settimeout   which causes a condition that prevents a login  if the timeout value is really big

column2: Why are the users unable to login to Web GUI 8 1 after I modify timeout to 2147483647 in security xml file   I followed the Web GUI 8 1 reference guide here to switching off the session timeouthttp   www 01 ibm com support knowledgecenter SSSHTQ 8 1 0 com ibm netcool OMNIbus doc 8 1 0 webtop wip task web adm settimeout htmlAfter I edited  config cells JazzSMNode01Cell security xml file  modified timeout setting to 2147483647  users are not able to login anymore
column3: Note  2147483647 is the maximum positive value for a 32 bit signed binary integer in computing

column2: Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method  Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method for SSL proxy requests
column3: Forward Proxy XMLFW MPGW CONNECT TUNNEL TECHNOTE  TROUBLESHOOTING PROBLEM ABSTRACT  How to configure an IBM WebSphere DataPower SOA Appliance Service to proxy an SSL request to a remote proxy server using the CONNECT method for SSL tunneling

column2: Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method  Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method for SSL proxy requests
column3: CAUSEMany common forward proxy servers expect requests in different formats depending on if they are proxying non SSL or SSL requests

column2: Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method  Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method for SSL proxy requests
column3: For example  a non SSL request to be proxied may come in the form of GET hostname port URI

column2: Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method  Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method for SSL proxy requests
column3: For SSL requests to be proxied  remote proxy servers are commonly configured to tunnel the request from the client to the backend server

column2: Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method  Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method for SSL proxy requests
column3: In the SSL request scenario  remote proxy servers will typically expect a CONNECT request and then tunnel the SSL request from the client to the backend server

column2: Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method  Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method for SSL proxy requests
column3: Users configuring DataPower may need a way to implement this CONNECT method for SSL tunneling to a remote Proxy Server

column2: Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method  Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method for SSL proxy requests
column3: RESOLVING THE PROBLEMNon SSL Proxy requests will work using either a  an XML Firewall when configuring in the HTTP Options tab  where the user can configure the Proxy Host and Portb  a Multi Protocol Gateway when configuring an HTTP Proxy Policy in the User AgentSSL Proxy requests will work using the CONNECT method for SSL Tunneling when using a Multi Protocol Gateway when configuring in a User Agent s HTTP Proxy Policy

column2: Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method  Does IBM DataPower Gateway Appliance support the HTTP CONNECT method for SSL proxy requests
column3: The XML Firewall service is not designed to use the CONNECT method for SSL Tunneling

column3: SECURITY BULLETINSUMMARY IBM WebSphere MQ 5 3 and IBM MQ 8 for HPE NonStop have addressed a vulnerability in which OpenSSL could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information  caused by an error while parsing an IPAddressFamily extension in an X 509 certificate VULNERABILITY DETAILSCVEID  CVE 2017 3735  http   cve mitre org cgi bin cvename cgi name CVE 2017 3735 DESCRIPTION  OpenSSL could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information  caused by an error while parsing an IPAddressFamily extension in an X 509 certificate
